definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: One of the cases was badly smashed and the contents were seriously damaged.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一個箱子散架了，裏面的東西嚴重損壞。

sentences.english: Why don't we get ourselves a new car?The old one's falling apart.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們不給自己買輛新車？舊的那部快要散架了。

sentences.english: A balance wheel keeps machinery from shaking apart.
sentences.chinese: 那就是一個平衡輪使社會機器不至散架。

sentences.english: I just got this car and already it's falling apart.
sentences.chinese: 我這輛車剛買就快散架了。

sentences.english: The car's bodywork scarcely holds together.
sentences.chinese: 這汽車的車身簡直都要散架了。

sentences.english: Month frowned, seemed to be falling apart like, and stomach pain.
sentences.chinese: 月月皺了皺眉，全身好像散架了似的，而且肚子也痛。

sentences.english: Without them, the machine would fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有它們，機器就會散架。

sentences.english: Hard-learned lessons in how to fall jar the bones at Tokyo's Musashigawa Beya.
sentences.chinese: 武藏川部屋，練習如何摔倒的艱苦課程令人骨頭散架。

sentences.english: Sure, no one would buy a bike that falls to pieces quickly.
sentences.chinese: 那當然，誰也不會買一砬就散架的車子。

definition: to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
